oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Confederate veteran C.E. Dale
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of an elderly C.E. Dale, who served as a private in Co. D, 4th Tenn. Cav. Regt. (Murray's), CSA, organized at Livingston of Overton County men in November, 1861. The Dale family owned land where Dale Hollow Dam was built. There were six brothers who all served in the Civil War. Five brothers returned home at the end of the war, while one, William Jackson Dale, was killed in the Chattanooga area.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dale, C.E.
